etymology.description: Pictogram: a woman with breasts kneeling or standing; modern form reversed from oracle forms, with the enclosed area as the remnant of the right breast and the left breast lost.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a female figure with a curved torso and a remaining breast, historically shown kneeling and later flipped to face right in standard script. Graphically related to 母 and 毋, which retain more breast/nipple detail, while the similar-looking 卩 is unrelated.

examples.chinese: 她是一个勇敢的女人(她是一個勇敢的女人)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yí gè yǒnggǎn de nǚrén.

examples.chinese: 他们有一个可爱的女儿(他們有一個可愛的女兒)，正在上小学(正在上小學)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen yǒu yí gè kě'ài de nǚ'ér, zhèngzài shàng xiǎoxué.
examples.english: They have a lovely daughter who is in primary school.

examples.chinese: 这家公司的女员工很多(這家公司的女員工很多)，工作表现很出色(工作表現很出色)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā gōngsī de nǚ yuángōng hěn duō, gōngzuò biǎoxiàn hěn chūsè.
examples.english: This company has many female employees, and their work performance is outstanding.
